alert.note: Alert for Cass; Mason; Menard (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:00AM CST until further notice by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lincoln IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Sangamon River near Oakford affecting Menard, Cass and Mason Counties. .The Emergency Manager has reported the formation of an ice jam along the Sangamon River near Oakford. Be aware for rapid rises around and upstream of the area of the jam. When ice breaks, rapid rises can quickly filter downstream. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sangamon River near Oakford. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 471.0 feet, Flooding begins to agricultural areas not protected by levees. At 476.3 feet, Water overtops the South Sangamon East Levee. At 476.9 feet, Water reaches the top of Mason, Menard Special, and Oakford levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 472.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CST Thursday was 472.4 feet. - Forecast...At the current time, an ice jam is causing rapid rises along the river. Future rises may exceed current stage. - Flood stage is 471.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Sangamon River Oakford 471.0 472.4 Thu 8 am CST 470.2 470.7 470.7 &&
info.instruction: Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
